meanings.definition: The act of uttering or expressing something verbally.
meanings.sent1: Her iterance of the poem was filled with emotion.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's iterance of the instructions was clear and concise.
meanings.sent3: His iterance of the joke made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The iterance of her love for him echoed in the room.
meanings.sent5: The iterance of the national anthem brought tears to their eyes.

meanings.definition: The repetition or reiteration of a process or action.
meanings.sent1: The iterance of the song on the radio annoyed him.
meanings.sent2: The iterance of the alarm clock woke him up every morning.
meanings.sent3: The iterance of the doorbell made the dog bark incessantly.
meanings.sent4: The iterance of the waves crashing on the shore was calming.
meanings.sent5: The iterance of his footsteps echoed in the empty hallway.
